name: Titanium.UI.Button
summary: A button widget that has four states: normal, disabled, focused and selected.

properties.name: attributedString
properties.summary: Specify an attributed string for the label.
properties.description:
The underlying attributed string drawn by the label. If set, avoid setting common attributes in the label, such as color and font, as unexpected behaviors may result.

iOS Note: This property can also be used to supress the underline style when accessibility is enabled. To do so, set the type to ATTRIBUTE_UNDERLINES_STYLE and the value to ATTRIBUTE_UNDERLINE_STYLE_NONE.

properties.name: backgroundDisabledImage
properties.summary: Background image for the button in its disabled state, specified as a local file path or URL.
properties.description: Also sets the background image for the other button states (normal, focused, selected), unless they've been specified explicitly, except for iOS, which requires a backgroundImage.

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.summary: Background image for the button in its focused state, specified as a local file path or URL.
properties.description: Focusable must be true for normal views. Sets the background image for the focused state only. For iOS, since there is not a trackball, this does nothing.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.summary: Background image for the button in its normal state, specified as a local file path or URL.
properties.description: Also sets the background image for the other button states (disabled, focused, selected), unless they've been specified explicitly. On iOS, if backgroundDisabledImage is unset, the image will appear faded to indicate being disabled. Also on iOS, if backgroundSelectedImage is unset, the image will be darkened to indicate being selected.

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.summary: Selected background color of the view, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.summary: Background image for the button in its selected state, specified as a local file path or URL.
properties.description: On Android, Focusable must be true in order to be selected. Sets the background image for the selected state only.

properties.name: color
properties.summary: Default button text color, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: disabledColor
properties.summary: Text color of the button in its disabled state, as a color name or hex triplet.

properties.name: enabled
properties.summary: Set to true to enable the button, false to disable the button.

properties.name: font
properties.summary: Font to use for the button text.

properties.name: image
properties.summary: Image to display on the button, specified as a local path, URL or a Blob.
properties.description:
The image is displayed to the left of the title.

Support for using Titanium.Blob for this property is only available on Android and iOS.

properties.name: selectedColor
properties.summary: Button text color used to indicate the selected state, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: shadowColor
properties.summary: Shadow color of the title, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: Use in conjunction with shadowOffset and shadowRadius. For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: shadowOffset
properties.summary: Shadow offset of the title, as a dictionary with the properties x and y.

properties.name: shadowRadius
properties.summary: Shadow radius of the title.

properties.name: style
properties.summary: Style constant for the button, as defined in Titanium.UI.iOS.SystemButtonStyle.

properties.name: systemButton
properties.summary: Specifies an iOS system button appearance, as defined in Titanium.UI.iOS.SystemButton.
properties.description:
In JavaScript:

var cancelButton = Ti.UI.createButton({
    systemButton: Ti.UI.iOS.SystemButton.CANCEL
});

In Alloy, you can omit the namespace when setting the systemButton property on a <Button> element:

<Button systemButton="CAMERA"/>

properties.name: textAlign
properties.summary: Text alignment, specified using one of the Titanium.UI text alignment constants.

properties.name: tintColor
properties.summary: Button tint color.
properties.description: This property is a direct correspondant of the tintColor property of UIView on iOS. If no value is specified, the tintColor of the View is inherited from its superview.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: Button title.

properties.name: titleid
properties.summary: Key identifying a string from the locale file to use for the button title.
properties.description: Only one of title or titleid should be specified.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.summary: Vertical alignment for the text field, specified using one of the vertical alignment constants from Titanium.UI.
